channel.title: BBC News

item.title: Trump plans to lift Syria sanctions and touts $142bn arms deal on Saudi visit
item.description: The US president gets a "lavender-carpet" reception on a whirlwind visit of Gulf countries mainly focused on shoring up investment.

item.title: Deals, handshakes and Musk - Key moments in Trump's Saudi visit
item.description: US President Donald Trump has said the US has "no stronger partner" than Saudi Arabia during his first major foreign trip.

item.title: Judge agrees to resentence Menendez brothers over 1989 murders
item.description: The decision could pave the way for Erik and Lyle Menendez to be released on parole, after being found guilty of killing their parents in 1989.

item.title: Top takeaways from ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura's testimony at Diddy trial
item.description: Ms Ventura told the court of the "humiliation" and physical abuse she said she endured from the rapper.

item.title: 'This is my closure': Emotional Kim Kardashian shares fears and forgives robber in court
item.description: The celebrity businesswoman grew tearful as she gave evidence in the trial of 10 people accused of robbing her at gunpoint.

item.title: Canada's Carney unveils cabinet of familiar and fresh faces amid US trade war
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney's cabinet reshuffle includes changes to the core team overseeing the fraught US-Canada relationship.

item.title: Is Trump allowed to accept $400m luxury plane as a gift?
item.description: The US leader has faced criticism over his plan to accept a plane from Qatar worth an estimated $400m.

item.title: Dozens of white South Africans arrive in US under Trump refugee plan
item.description: Donald Trump says they are victims of "racial discrimination", which is strongly denied by South Africa.

item.title: US-Israeli hostage reunites with family after being freed by Hamas
item.description: Edan Alexander, 21, is the first hostage to be released by Hamas since a ceasefire ended in March.

item.title: Trump's order on US drug prices: What's in it, and will it work?
item.description: The president promises sweeping price cuts "almost immediately", but experts say these are unlikely.

item.title: Rapper Tory Lanez stabbed 14 times in California prison attack
item.description: The Canadian hip-hop artist is serving a 10-year sentence for shooting and injuring Megan Thee Stallion.

item.title: Trump defends plan to use Qatari luxury jet for Air Force One
item.description: Trump says he'd be "stupid" to not accept the aircraft "free of charge", after Qatar denied it amounted to a gift.

item.title: Trump's mediation offer on Kashmir puts India in a tight spot
item.description: For decades, third-party mediation on Kashmir has been taboo in the Indian foreign ministry.

item.title: Watch: President Trump arrives in Saudi Arabia
item.description: In the first major diplomatic trip during his second term, the president is hoping to secure significant new investment in the US in the four-day trip to Saudi Arabia, Qatar and UAE.

item.title: Watch: Why US is granting white South Africans refugee status
item.description: A US-funded flight carrying a group of 59 refugees landed in Virginia on Monday after leaving Johannesburg on Sunday.

item.title: Watch: Coercion or consent? Opening statements in Diddy trial
item.description: Prosecutors allege the rapper used fame and violence to sexually abuse women, while the rapper's attorneys defended his "swinger" lifestyle.

item.title: White House 'actively looking at' suspending habeas corpus
item.description: Miller comments come as judges have sought to challenge some recent detentions made by the Trump administration in an effort to combat illegal immigration

item.title: 'He's one of us' - Catholic Americans react to first US-born pope
item.description: Robert Prevost is originally from Chicago, where he served as an altar boy and was ordained as a priest in 1982.

item.title: What does the US-China tariff deal mean?
item.description: The agreement marks a major de-escalation of the trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

item.title: China has come to the table - but this fight is far from over
item.description: Beijing can claim its defiance has delivered a battle victory in the trade war.

item.title: One of Alcatraz's last living inmates on Trump's plan to reopen prison
item.description: Charlie Hopkins was imprisoned in Alcatraz in the 1950s, where he spent three "lonely" years.

item.title: Along the Canada border, small-town America feels sting of Trump's trade war
item.description: Since the trade war began, crossings between the US and Canada are down some 17%. What has that cost towns such as Port Huron and Michigan?

item.title: What is habeas corpus and why might Donald Trump want to suspend it?
item.description: It is a safeguard against unlawful imprisonment - but the White House is "actively looking" at pausing it.

item.title: What is Sean 'Diddy' Combs charged with and how long will his trial last?
item.description: The jury in the federal sex trafficking trial will be sworn in on Monday before opening statements are delivered.

item.title: 'I've practised being booed', Israel's Eurovision entry who survived Hamas attack tells BBC
item.description: Yuval Raphael, who survived the 7 October attack, says performing her ballad New Day Will Rise is a "personal win".
